review: It does the things I wanted it to do - play netflix on the big TV, watch files from my PC on the TV.  However, once the chromecast is on, I pretty much can't use my wireless on any other device.  This makes casting something to the TV take a while, unless I use the one wired PC in my home.  I did not expect this issue because I have a lot of bandwidth and have often had like 3 different devices streaming wireless no problem, but have the chromecast on and I can't check my email now? Not the best.Also using the Videostream app to stream files from the PC to the TV works great, but you can only do one file at a time.  When I am watching 11 minute videos this gets pretty annoying pretty quickly.

review: It was very cool until we tried the Amazon stick.  The Amzon stick seems to have almost all the same uses, and can do a little more.  The Firestick can access your Amazon music, and Amazon Prime video.  Basically, you'll probably like the Amazon Firestick better.
author: Dan Powers

review: What can I say. This is excellent. I have two now, and am dependent on them. I travelled recently, and did not have my Chromecast, and missed it terribly. I use this to screencast to my TV so we can collaborate on work, watch John Oliver on Monday morning on Youtube, and fifty other things. I am amazed at the usefulness of this Roku killer. The downside is that it requires an Android device, or you are limited to streaming what can be viewed in a Google Chrome web browser tab.One thing: When you install it, you might find that it does not connect to your home network. You may need to jigger with the channels on your router, and turn off "auto". Set the router to use channel 1 or channel 6. Then restart the router. That has always fixed it for me.
